alert.note: Alert for Modoc County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 2:57PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Modoc County through 330 PM PDT... At 257 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mill Creek Falls Campground, or 22 miles south of Cedarville, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pepperdine Campground, Mill Creek Falls Campground and Soup Spring Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
